thread.title: Man hospitalised after late night stabbing in New Plymouth
thread.title_full: Man hospitalised after late night stabbing in New Plymouth

author: Brittany Baker
title: Man hospitalised after late night stabbing in New Plymouth
text:
Man hospitalised after late night stabbing in New Plymouth BRITTANY BAKER Last updated 11:00, February 26 2017 SIMON MAUDE/FAIRFAX NZ 
A 23-year-old man and a 17-year-old woman have been charged. 
A man has been stabbed in the neck after confronting two motorists who were performing "burnouts". 
The confrontation occurred just before midnight on Friday in the Everett Rd area. 
"As a result of an altercation, one male has suffered cut or slash marks to his neck," Detective Sergeant Chris Allemann, of the Taranaki CIB, said. 
A 23-year-old man faces a charge of wounding with intent to cause grievous bodily harm, and a 17-year-old woman has been charged with being an accessory after the fact.
